text: Holly Dunn (August 22, 1957 â€“ November 14, 2016) was an American country music singer-songwriter. She recorded for MTM Records from 1985 to 1988. She recorded for Warner Bros. Records from 1988 to 1993. She recorded for the River North Records from 1995 to 1997. She released 10 studio albums and 19 singles. Two of Dunn's releases "Are You Ever Gonna Love Me" and "You Really Had Me Going" hit #1 on the United States Billboard Hot Country Songs chart. She is also known for "Maybe I Mean Yes" and "Daddy's Hands." Dunn was born in San Antonio, Texas. She died from ovarian cancer in Albuquerque, New Mexico. ==References== Category:1957 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Musicians from San Antonio, Texas Category:Singers from San Antonio, Texas Category:Country musicians from Texas Category:Cancer deaths in New Mexico Category:Deaths from ovarian cancer
title: Holly Dunn
